before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"e2s9k","text":"Take all the reagencies out of a freezer and let them temperate to room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8cmds","text":"The protocol was designed to quantify microbial eukaryotic fungi using ITS region copy number evaluation by Droplet Digital PCR technology (ddPCR) from Bio-Rad company. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":108,"length":38}],"data":{}},{"key":"85pcq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1u68","text":"For the assay, we are using a universal fungal ITS rRNA primer pair:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31qh","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rrv3","text":"ITS1f         5'- CTT GGT CAT TTA GAG GAA GTA A -3', 38 bp upstream of ITS1 from White et al., 1990","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":81,"length":18}],"data":{}},{"key":"5ft92","text":"ITS2          5'- GCT GCG TTC TTC ATC GAT GC -3', identical to ITS2 from White et al., 1990until now because of its extreme length variability among the fungi species. In fact, this variability introduced a bias to final copy numbers estimated by qPCR,.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":73,"length":18}],"data":{}},{"key":"noe6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7noa9","text":"Amplicon size: ~250–600 bp (Bokulich \u0026 Mills, 2013; Hoggart et al., 2018)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":28,"length":22},{"key":4,"offset":52,"length":20}],"data":{}},{"key":"3kmsd","text":"The same ITS1f and ITS2 primers are recommended for use for fungi identification by the Earth Microbiome Project.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"910mr","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aimmv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"FC9D0D1D8AE111EAAF890A58A9FEAC2A","url":"https://www.bio-rad.com/en-cz/applications-technologies/droplet-digital-pcr-ddpcr-technology?ID=MDV31M4VY"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"796B7F1108224DABB2B3A494DE4DE1BD","url":"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/B9780123721808500421?via%3Dihub"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"11CDFFAEF8F543A2B7A429C2D52ABBCA","url":"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/B9780123721808500421?via%3Dihub"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AEDB6C198DE641FBAE5EB898E1F9562E","url":"https://journals.asm.org/doi/10.1128/aem.03870-12"}},"4":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CE2C9E54D4AE41F88939AE6C3805F0CA","url":"https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/microbiology/articles/10.3389/fmicb.2018.02208/full"}},"5":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3o9dl","text":"Internal Transcribed Spacer (ITS) has not been possible to use for fungi quantification until now because of its extreme length variability among the fungi species. In fact, this variability introduced a bias to final copy numbers estimated by qPCR, which was overcome here with the ddPCR method.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

groups.title: SoWa RI Anaerobic and Molecular Microbiology (public)

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"cbn4h","text":"The crucial steps that can influence the final assay results a lot are precise pipetting, mixing and dilutions!","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":71,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8ibca","text":"Keep in mind that ddPCR technigue do not posses as wide dynamic concentration range as qPCR does. You can easily \"overload\" the reaction with too much template DNA putting in. In that case you will see only positive droplets at the end and no negative and system will not be able to calculate copy number for them. As a consequence, you usually have to dilute your template DNA more than for qPCR experiments. Ideally fit inside the range of 101 - 104 coppies of target gene. That is why we usually test several dilutions of few samples in advance to see \"where we are\".","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":444,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":450,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2m762","text":"One have to also keep in mind that using ddPCR technology you must work within the format of eight. If you do not fulfil all the wells in a cartridge you still have to put the reagencies inside the empty wells as well. So, think economically before you start.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"40nl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4s6gu","text":"Set up the QuntaSoft experiment as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eim3u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4racb","text":"Exp. type:        Absolute quantification (ABS)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43mud","text":"Supermix:       QX200 ddPCR EvaGreen Supermix ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23j1i","text":"Target1:          Ch1 (for FAM labeled probes)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fh91l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ra6h","text":"Define the position of ech sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eqh52","text":"Check the levels of reader Oil and waste - green control (bottles are physically accessible from machines left side). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"auf3l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4kckn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"19nnb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5ac9r","text":"If the instrument was not in use longer than week it has to be Primed first (oil flushed).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5hs8h","text":"Start measurement.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"drlnp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"856kq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7tlr1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f7rsk","text":"After it finishes go over the results and see how many droplets were executed for each sample. To get reliable results total droplet count should be above 12.000. We usually have got 18.000 - 20.000 droplets analyzed per sample.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":null,"inlineStyleRanges":null,"key":"cuxve","text":"  ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c9fhu","text":" ","type":"atomic"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f1993","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"F097727F344811EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":247.30181818181808,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"69d9d\",\"text\":\"an example of total droplets count (positive together with negative ones) being generated and read\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/public/1699dc345bd1e79cfd8cb53f5b62703b3208b8c6ce5a9fb99440ba631b9884a4/b97xi2aw.png","source":"https://content.protocols.io/public/1699dc345bd1e79cfd8cb53f5b62703b3208b8c6ce5a9fb99440ba631b9884a4/b97wi2aw.png","type":1,"width":576.3389830508476},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"image"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f5e0","text":"Set up the treshold just above negative control sample in order to distinguish positive (containing PCR products) from negative (do not contain any PCR product) droplets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djlve","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"btm75","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ylvcv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"moklv","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":null,"entityRanges":null,"data":{}},{"key":"ccrrl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6bhdd","text":"Quanta software will automaticaly calculate copy number of target gene for each sample by Poisson distribution algorithm. For that calculations at least some of the negative droplets are necessary. If the sample contains only positive population it can not be evaluated. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F09935C0344811EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":325.8545454545454,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"b59be\",\"text\":\"An example of ITS Fungi copy numbers data analysis. Last two samples on the left graph are negative (NTC) samples by which a treshold was set up. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/public/1699dc345bd1e79cfd8cb53f5b62703b3208b8c6ce5a9fb99440ba631b9884a4/b973i2aw.png","source":"https://content.protocols.io/public/1699dc345bd1e79cfd8cb53f5b62703b3208b8c6ce5a9fb99440ba631b9884a4/b972i2aw.png","type":1,"width":580}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4e0sh","text":"Export .csv file with concentrations (copies/ul) that are posessing you the number of copies in 1ul of reaction. To obtain number of copies in 1ul of your input DNA you have to recalculate:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hp8c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3si1d","text":"no. of copies in 1ul of input DNA = (concentration value x 22)/ volume of DNA ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
